page.title: 04GOVAN TALES
page.content: In the centre of Govan there is a pub called Brechin's Bar. Attached to the guttering there is a stone cat twisting round to catch a rat. It is believed that Govan will cease to exist when the cat falls down. Govan High School staged a show and entertainment, including Madame Krystle, the fourtune-teller, a teacher disguised, sitting in an incense haze. Her prophecies were repeated in all seriousness, although much altered in the re-telling. In front of Govan Old Parish Church is a grave yard known as the 'gravey', said to be haunted by 'Baldy Apple', who died choking on an apple. He trails through the graveyard, coughing, choking and spluttering.
